page.title: 14Caledonian Canal: 2
page.content: { {The Canal as a Tourist Attraction} The canal banks allow for a very pleasant walk. Tourists and locals can enjoy watching the passage of craft up and down the 'Staircase' and notice along their way the old Lock-keepers' houses with their bow-windows built and lived in by Thomas Telford in the 1820's. The opening and closing of the canal is now fully automated but there are preserved the remains of the old capstans and chain holes of times when it took 126 turns of the capstan to allow passage for every boat using the canal.
